definition: glaringly noticeable usually because of inexcusable badness or objectionableness, out-and-out, utter
visible without the aid of a microscope

examples: Now to all sense 'tis gross you love my son.

definition: coarse in nature or behavior : unrefined
gravely deficient in civility or decency : crudely vulgar
examples: merely gross, a scatological rather than a pornographic impropriety

definition: of, relating to, or dealing with general aspects or broad distinctions
examples: a gross outline of the plan

definition: consisting of an overall total exclusive of deductions, — compare net
growing or spreading with excessive luxuriance
made up of material or perceptible elements
to earn or bring in (an overall total) exclusive of deductions (as for taxes or expenses)
examples: The movie grossed over 100 million dollars.
The company's gross doubled in five years.
